009package ImageJ_Demos;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
013import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
014
015/**
016 * This ImageJ plugin shows how a subimage is extracted from
017 * a given image using the bounding box of the currently selected 
018 * region of interest (ROI). Note that the resulting image is
019 * of the same type as the original.
020 * 
021 * @author WB
022 * @version 2022/04/01
023 */
024public class Roi_Extract_Subimage_Demo implements PlugInFilter {
025
026        ImagePlus im = null;
027
028        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
029                this.im = im;
030                return DOES_ALL + NO_CHANGES;
031        }
032
033        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
034                // The ROI obtained from ImageProcessor always exists even without a user selection.
035                // It is a rectangle with int coordinates.
036                // By default (no user selection) the ROI contains the whole image.
037                // Rectangle roi = ip.getRoi();
038                ImageProcessor ip2 = ip.crop();         // extracts the subimage defined by the ROI
039                new ImagePlus(im.getShortTitle() + "-extracted", ip2).show();
040        }
041}
